intro: Trachelium asperuloides, commonly known as the rough-leaved trachelium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Trachelium asperuloides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
